result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell M. Wanke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: or 40 hours of community service - defendant chose community service.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell M. Wanke

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:50 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Russell M. Wanke in court with Attorney Erika L Bierma in court.
Parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant enters a guilty plea on count 2: Disorderly Conduct as a domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, 40 hours of community service or 5 days of jail. Defendant chose community service. Defendant has 3 days of jail credit, so ordered. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Russell M. Wanke in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma appeared by video for Russell M. Wanke. Parties are close to an agreement.
